root.name: Kamaitachi no Yoru
root.description: OverviewKamaitachi no Yoru (The Night of the Sickle Weasels in English) was the second sound novel created by Chunsoft after the release of Otogirisou. The game was originally released for the Super Famicom in 1994 and was later ported to the Playstation in 1998, the Gameboy Advance and Mobile Phones in 2002, and to the Wii in 2007.Kamaitachi no Yoru received two sequels on the PS2 which were Kamaitachi no Yoru 2: Kangokujima no Warabe Uta and Kamaitachi no Yoru Triple: Mikazukishima Jiken no Shinsou. The fourth sequel Shin Kamaitachi no Yoru: 11ninme no Suspect was released in 2011 for the PS3 and PlayStation Vita.In 2012, it was announced that Kamaitachi no Yoru would be localized into English for the first time by Agetec and would be released for iOS platforms but no further information has been revealed about the release.ReceptionKamaitachi no Yoru became one of Chunsoft's most popular games in Japan with all the remakes and ports combined selling almost a million copies. The game's popularity encouraged other developers to create similar games and soon the term "sound novel" represented a whole genre instead of just games made by Chunsoft.
